sndlib.core.network
Class Demand

java.lang.Object
  sndlib.core.network.Demand

public final class Demand
extends java.lang.Object

This class represents a single traffic demand between two nodes in a Network.

Besides its ID a demand has several properties, such as the demand value, the routing unit and the hop limit. Also a set of admissible paths can be specified for each demand, which is used if the demand model is EXPLICIT_PATHS.

For constructing a new Demand a parent Network is needed.

Author:
Roman Klaehne
See Also:
Network, Network.newDemand(String, Node, Node)

Method Detail

getId

public java.lang.String getId()
Returns the ID of this demand.

Returns:
the ID of this demand

setMaxPathLength

public void setMaxPathLength(int maxPathLength)
Sets maximum number of links (hop limit) used on a path to route this demand. It is interpreted for a specific demand such that the routing paths must not consist of more than the given maxPathLength links during normal operation. An argument of zero indicates that there is no hop limit restriction for this demand.

Parameters:
maxPathLength - the maximum path length; or zero for no restriction
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the given maximum path length is lower than zero.

hasMaxPathLength

public boolean hasMaxPathLength()
Returns true if and only if this demand has a positive maximum path length restriction. This method is equivalent to getMaxPathLength() > 0.

Returns:
true if this demand has a positive maximum path length restriction; false otherwise

getMaxPathLength

public int getMaxPathLength()
Returns the maximum path length used for this demand. If this method returns zero then there is no restriction for the maximum path length.

Returns:
the maximum path length restriction for this demand; zero if there is no restriction

getFirstNode

public Node getFirstNode()
Returns the first (source) node of this demand.

Returns:
the first (source) node of this demand

getDemandValue

public double getDemandValue()
Returns the value (traffic rate) of this demand.

Returns:
the value of this demand

setDemandValue

public void setDemandValue(double value)
Sets the value (traffic rate) of this demand. It is interpreted for a specific demand such that at least routingUnit times demandValue many units must be routed through the network during normal operation (where all network components are active).

Parameters:
value - the demand value
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the given demand value is lower than or equal to zero.

getRoutingUnit

public int getRoutingUnit()
Returns the individual routing unit of this demand.

Returns:
the routing unit of this demand

setRoutingUnit

public void setRoutingUnit(int unit)
Sets the individual routing unit of this demand. With an integer routing model every routing path used for this demand must carry an integer multiple of the routing unit. Independent of the routing model, the total traffic rate of this demand is routingUnit times demandValue.

Parameters:
unit - the routing unit
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the given routing unit is lower than or equal to zero

hasAdmissiblePath

public boolean hasAdmissiblePath(java.lang.String pathId)
Tests whether this demand has an admissible path with the specified ID.

Parameters:
pathId - the ID of the path to look for
Returns:
true if and only if this demand has an admissible path with the specified ID; false otherwise

removeAdmissiblePath

public boolean removeAdmissiblePath(AdmissiblePath path)
Removes the given admissible path from this demand.

Parameters:
path - the path to remove
Returns:
true if and only if the path was removed from this demand; false otherwise

public int admissiblePathCount()
Returns the number of admissible paths of this demand.

Returns:
the number of admissible paths

admissiblePaths

public java.util.Collection<AdmissiblePath> admissiblePaths()
Returns a Collection view of the admissible paths of this demand. The returned collection is not modifiable, i.e., any attempt to modify the collection will cause an UnsupportedOperationException.

Returns:
an unmodifiable collection view of the admissible paths of this demand

getAdmissiblePath

Returns the admissible path with the specified ID.

Parameters:
pathId - the ID of the path
Returns:
the admissible path with the specified ID; null if such a path does not exist
